explanation: The report is correct. MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 states a function parameter shall not be modified. In metal_io_block_read the parameter len is assigned to (len = io->size - offset;) and is decremented/changed in the loops (len--, len -= sizeof(int), etc.). Those are direct modifications of a non-pointer formal parameter and therefore violate Rule 17.8. (By contrast, dest and ptr are local variables derived from parameters and modifying them is permitted; the rule’s note only allows modifying the object referred to by a pointer parameter, not the parameter itself.) Recommended fix: copy len into a local variable (e.g. remaining or left) and modify that local variable instead of the parameter.
